id.description: The unique identifier of the business line.

capability.description: The capability for which you are creating the business line. For example, **receivePayments**.

industryCode.description: A code that represents the industry of your legal entity. For example, **4431A** for computer software stores.

legalEntityId.description: Unique identifier of the [legal entity](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/legalentity/latest/post/legalEntities__resParam_id) that owns the business line.

salesChannels.description:
A list of channels where goods or services are sold.

Possible values: **pos**, **posMoto**, **eCommerce**, **ecomMoto**, **payByLink**.

Required only in combination with the `service` **paymentProcessing**.

service.description:
The service for which you are creating the business line.



Possible values:
*  **paymentProcessing**
*  **banking**

webData.description: List of website URLs where your user's goods or services are sold. When this is required for a service but your user does not have an online presence, provide the reason in the `webDataExemption` object.

acquiringBusinessLineId.description: The unique identifier of the business line that will be the source of funds.This must be a business line for a **receivePayments** or **receiveFromPlatformPayments** capability.
acquiringBusinessLineId.x-deprecatedMessage: This field will be removed in v4.

adyenProcessedFunds.description: Indicates whether the funds are coming from transactions processed by Adyen. If **false**, a `description` is required.

description.description: Text describing the source of funds. For example, for `type` **business**, provide a description of where the business transactions come from, such as payments through bank transfer. Required when `adyenProcessedFunds` is **false**.

type.description: The type of the source of funds. Possible value: **business**.

webAddress.description: The URL of the website or the app store URL.

webAddressId.description: The unique identifier of the web address.

reason.description: The reason why the web data was not provided. Possible value: **noOnlinePresence**.

$ul: **capability**: The capability for which you are creating the business line.
**id**: The unique identifier of the business line.

**industryCode**: A code that represents the [industry of the legal entity](https://docs.adyen.com/marketplaces-and-platforms/verification-requirements/reference-additional-products/#list-industry-codes). For example, **4431A** for computer software stores.
**legalEntityId**: Unique identifier of the [legal entity](https://docs.adyen.com/api-explorer/#/legalentity/latest/post/legalEntities__resParam_id) that owns the business line.
**problems**: The verification errors related to capabilities for this supporting entity.
**salesChannels**: A list of channels where goods or services are sold.
**service**: The service for which you are creating the business line.
**sourceOfFunds**

**acquiringBusinessLineId**: The unique identifier of the business line that will be the source of funds.This must be a business line for a **receivePayments** or **receiveFromPlatformPayments** capability.
**adyenProcessedFunds**: Indicates whether the funds are coming from transactions processed by Adyen. If **false**, a `description` is required.

**description**: Text describing the source of funds. For example, for `type` **business**, provide a description of where the business transactions come from, such as payments through bank transfer. Required when `adyenProcessedFunds` is **false**.
**type**: The type of the source of funds. Possible value: **business**.

**webData**: List of website URLs where your user's goods or services are sold. When this is required for a service but your user does not have an online presence, provide the reason in the `webDataExemption` object.
**webDataExemption**
**reason**: The reason why the web data was not provided. Possible value: **noOnlinePresence**.
**errorCode**: The error code mapped to the error message.
**errorType**: The category of the error.
**message**: A short explanation of the issue.
**pspReference**: The PSP reference of the payment.
**status**: The HTTP response status.
